meaningMnemonic:
Someone of <kanji>few</kanji> <kanji>year</kanji>s is someone who's young. Since we already have 少女 for girls, 少年 means <vocabulary>boy</vocabulary>.

少年 is a bit of a formal term that often refers to a <vocabulary>young boy</vocabulary>, usually between childhood and adolescence, or sometimes to a <vocabulary>youth</vocabulary> in general.
